sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: From 1973 to 1990, during the rule of dictator Augusto Pinochet, it's believed some 3,200 leftist activists and other suspected opponents were killed by the regime. Pinochet died in 2006 without ever being convicted of the crimes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02

The president of the jury, American director Damien Chazelle, has expressed his support for the walkout and for cinema as art, not as content to feed a channel. David Morricone does more from the Serenissimo. The 80th edition of the Venice Film Festival kicked off with the Italian World War II film Comandante, which replaced Luca Guadagnino's Challengers due to the ongoing writers and actor strikes in the US. It's a strong sub, as the film finds humanity in the darkest of places as World War II submariners disobey their orders and save some of their enemies. But the main talking point on the Lido at the moment is still the inclusion in the lineup of three controversial directors, Roman Polanski, Woody Allen and Luc Besson.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
